title: Pixel 4 XL not saving GPS location in photo file metadata (EXIF tags)
content:
I sometimes (but not always) want my camera's photo files to record the GPS location where I took the photo.

Unfortunately, I am never seemingly able to get this to work.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Details:

My camera app has the setting for "Save location" enabled.  (I think that this is the default setting; I never changed it; I have confirmed that my camera is set to enable this.)

I generally do not use the Google Photos app, but I can confirm that its setting for "Remove geo location" is disabled.

If I then turn on my phone's GPS location (I generally have it off), take a photo, email the photo file (is in default JPEG format) to myself, and then view the file's metadata on my PC, I see nothing there about the GPS location.

Concerning how I view the photo file's metadata, I have tried 3 different approaches:

1)  my PC is a Win 10 box, and you can do this from File Explorer: right click on the file --> Properties --> Details

2) open the file in XnView MP, view its properties

3) open the file in Exif Data Viewer

With all 3 approaches, I do see plenty of other EXIF metadata in the photo files, so it is not the case that none is written.

Its just that I never see anything that looks like GPS location data.

By the way, does anyone know the exact EXIF tag name used for the GPS location data?  Maybe I am overlooking it.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Misc:

I am aware of this discussion on this website, where Alex Sokolov seems to report a similar issue, with no apparent solution.

About a year ago, a beta version Android at one point mysteriously dropped EXIF support.

I always have my phone's "Google Location History" and "Google Location Sharing" turned off for privacy reasons.
